comment.shortText: Creates a clone of the given buffer
Concat the given list of buffers
Copy data from buffer A to buffer B

comment.text: an optional offset that determines where buffer A is copied into buffer B

comment.shortText: Create AudioBuffer options or source buffer.

Create a new AudioBuffer instance with the given options,
when the optional AudioBuffer parameter is given this instance
will be used to extract the options from.
Return array with the given bufferâ€™s per-channel data
Test whether two buffers are the same

Fill the given buffer with the given value. Default it fills the entire buffer unless
the start and end positions are also passed in.

comment.text: Optionally a second buffer can be passed that will receive the given values
Either a concrete value or a callback that returns a concrete value

comment.shortText:
Insert the source buffer at the given offset in the target buffer.
The optional length parameter determines the range in the target buffer
that will be overwritten by the source buffer.
Invert amplitude of samples in each channel
Get average level per-channel
Returns the audiobuffer position based on the given duration in milliseconds

Mix current bufferA with bufferB.
The reason to modify bufferA instead of returning the new buffer
is reduced amount of calculations and flexibility.
If required, the cloning can be done before mixing.
Fill the given buffer with white noise

Normalize the given buffer by the maximum value,
limit values by the -1..1 range
Pad the given buffer to the required size
Pad the given buffer to the required size from the left.
Pad the given buffer to the required size from the right.
remove DC offset
Repeat the given buffer the given amount of times
Change the length of the given buffer, by trimming or filling with zeros.
Reverse samples in each channel
Shift content of the given buffer in circular fashion
Returns the audiobuffer position based on the given duration in seconds

Create a buffer with the same characteristics as the given buffer, without copying
the data. Contents of resulting buffer are undefined.
Shift content of the buffer
Fill the given buffer with zeros
Size of the given buffer in bytes
Return a section of the given buffer
Split the given buffer into two separate buffers, cutting it in two at the given offset.
Trim buffer by removing zeros from the beginning and the end
Trim buffer by removing zeros from the beginning
Trim buffer by removing zeros from the end
